Helen Walker

Geekery

Jul 23, 2014

I realised whilst getting over excited about learning technologies yesterday, that not only do I consider myself to be a geek; I wear the title as a badge of honour.

I may not be the geekiest person in the world but I am entirely happy to claim the description. Not that I consider myself some kind of circus freak (which is how the word was originally used) I prefer the idea of someone with an obsessive interest is a particular topic, and I am, after all, obsessive about a whole range of things. From the properties of various types of craft adhesive, to the best cross-stitch needles (gold-plated size 26) science, sums, theatre... Oh and I love the intricacies of the work I do, I am utterly geektastic about being a trainer and knowing stuff that might help the people I work with.
So, you have been warned, if you bore easily try to avoid those topics of conversation, you may never escape!

This post was originally posted on theenthusiastictrainer.wordpress.com on 31 May 2013.
